description: Schema for DCAT-based GeoBlacklight 2.0 schema. See https://github.com/geoblacklight/geoblacklight/wiki/Schema for more details.
title: GeoBlacklight Schema v2.0

dataset.title: dataset
dataset.description: A GIS data layer or map. See [this example](https://github.com/OpenGeoMetadata/edu.stanford.purl/blob/master/bb/099/zb/1450/geoblacklight.json) metadata layer.

@context.description: Keyword Used to define the short-hand names that are used throughout the Geoblacklight JSON-LD document.

@id.description: Unique identifier for layer as a URI. It should be globally unique across all institutions, assumed not to be end-user visible, and is usually of the form `http://institution/id`. See https://github.com/geoblacklight/geoblacklight/wiki/Schema for more detailed documentation.

@type.description: Keyword used to used to set the data type of a node or typed value.

conformsTo.description: URI that identifies the version of the The version of the GeoBlacklight Schema to which this metadata record conforms.

describedBy.description: URI that references a codebook or documentation for the dataset *Optional*

accessURL.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset, for example via API. *One of downloadURL or accessURL required*

conformsTo.description: URI used to identify a standardized specification the distribution conforms to. *Required with accessURL *

downloadURL.description: URL providing direct access to a downloadable file of a dataset. *One of downloadURL or accessURL required*

format.description: File format(s) available for download, using a controlled vocabulary. *Optional*

layerId.description: The complete identifier for the layer via WMS/WFS/WCS protocol. *Optional*

@type.description: Keyword used to used to set the data type of the distribution.

distribution.description: An array of dcat:distribution objects which represents a specific available form of a dataset. Usually a download or web service.  *Optional*

geom.description: Bounding box of the layer as a ENVELOPE WKT (from the CQL standard) using coordinates in (West, East, North, South) order. Note that this field is indexed as a Solr spatial (RPT) field.

geomType.description: Geometry type for layer data, using a controlled vocabulary. *Optional*

isPartOf.description: Holding entity for the layer, such as the title of a collection. *Optional*

issued.description: Issued date for the layer, using XML Schema dateTime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ). *Optional*

landingPage.description: A human-friendly hub or landing page that users can be directed to for all resources tied to the dataset. *Optional*

language.description: Language for the dataset. Should adhere to the RFC 5646 standard. *Optional*.

license.description: Link to a legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource. *Optional*

modified.description: Last modification date for the metadata record, using XML Schema dateTime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ). *Optional*

resourceType.description: Resource type of the layer, using DCMI Type Vocabulary, usually a `Dataset`. *Optional*

rights.description: Human-readable information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies. *Optional*

slug.description: Identifies a layer in human-readable keywords. Note this value is visible to the user, and used for Permalinks. The value should be alpha-numeric characters separated by dashes, and is typically of the form `institution-keyword1-keyword2`. It should also be globally unique across all institutions in *your* GeoBlacklight index. See https://github.com/geoblacklight/geoblacklight/wiki/Schema for more detailed documentation.

source.description: The identity of a layer from which this layer's data was derived. *Optional*

spatial.description: Spatial coverage and place names for the layer, preferrably in a controlled vocabulary. *Optional*

subject.description: Subjects for the layer, preferrably in a controlled vocabulary. *Optional*

temporal.description: Temporal coverage for the layer, typically years or dates. Note that this field is not in a specific date format. *Optional*
